com.hazelcast.client.impl

Class ClientEngineImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.client.impl.ClientEngineImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientEngine, CoreService, EventPublishingService<ClientEvent,ClientListener>, ManagedService, MembershipAwareService, PreJoinAwareService, Consumer<ClientMessage>

    public class ClientEngineImpl
extends Object
implements ClientEngine, CoreService, PreJoinAwareService, ManagedService, MembershipAwareService, EventPublishingService<ClientEvent,ClientListener>
    Class that requests, listeners from client handled in node side.

      • getPreJoinOperation

        public Operation getPreJoinOperation()
        Description copied from interface: PreJoinAwareService
        An operation to be executed on the joining member before it is set as joined. As is the case with PostJoinAwareService.getPostJoinOperation()s, no partition locks, no key-based locks, no service level locks, no database interaction are allowed. Additionally, a pre-join operation is executed while the cluster lock is being held on the joining member, so it is important that the operation finishes quickly and does not interact with other locks. The Operation.getPartitionId() method should return a negative value. This means that the operations should not implement PartitionAwareOperation.

        Pre join operations should return response, which may also be a null response.

        Specified by:
        getPreJoinOperation in interface PreJoinAwareService
        Returns:
        an operation to be executed on joining member before it is set as joined. Can be null.

      • getConnectedClientStats

        public Map<ClientType,Integer> getConnectedClientStats()
        Description copied from interface: ClientEngine
        Returns Map which contains number of connected clients to the cluster. The returned map can be used to get information about connected clients to the cluster.
        Specified by:
        getConnectedClientStats in interface ClientEngine
        Returns:
        Map .

      • getClientStatistics

        public Map<String,String> getClientStatistics()
        Description copied from interface: ClientEngine
        The statistics is a String that is composed of key=value pairs separated by ',' . The following characters are escaped in IMap and ICache names by the escape character '\' : '=' '.' ',' '\' The statistics key identify the category and name of the statistics. It is formatted as: mainCategory.subCategory.statisticName An e.g. Operating system committedVirtualMemorySize path would be: os.committedVirtualMemorySize The statistics key names can be one of the following (Used IMap named and ICache Named and assuming that the Near Cache is configured): clientType clusterConnectionTimestamp credentials.principal clientAddress clientName enterprise lastStatisticsCollectionTime nearcache..creationTime nearcache..evictions nearcache..expirations nearcache..hits nearcache..lastPersistenceDuration nearcache..lastPersistenceFailure nearcache..lastPersistenceKeyCount nearcache..lastPersistenceTime nearcache..lastPersistenceWrittenBytes nearcache..misses nearcache..ownedEntryCount nearcache..ownedEntryMemoryCost nearcache.hz/.creationTime nearcache.hz/.evictions nearcache.hz/.expirations nearcache.hz/.hits nearcache.hz/.lastPersistenceDuration nearcache.hz/.lastPersistenceFailure nearcache.hz/.lastPersistenceKeyCount nearcache.hz/.lastPersistenceTime nearcache.hz/.lastPersistenceWrittenBytes nearcache.hz/.misses nearcache.hz/.ownedEntryCount nearcache.hz/.ownedEntryMemoryCost os.committedVirtualMemorySize os.freePhysicalMemorySize os.freeSwapSpaceSize os.maxFileDescriptorCount os.openFileDescriptorCount os.processCpuTime os.systemLoadAverage os.totalPhysicalMemorySize os.totalSwapSpaceSize runtime.availableProcessors runtime.freeMemory runtime.maxMemory runtime.totalMemory runtime.uptime runtime.usedMemory userExecutor.queueSize Not: Please observe that the name for the ICache appears to be the hazelcast instance name "hz" followed by "/" and followed by the cache name provided which is StatTestCacheName.
        Specified by:
        getClientStatistics in interface ClientEngine
        Returns:
        Map of [client UUID String, client statistics String]
